DataElement.preferredName: Prior Biopsy Or Excision Less First Pathologic Diagnosis Date Calculation Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Time interval from the date of the initial pathologic diagnosis to the date of a prior biopsy or resection, represented as a calculated number of days.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Biopsy Or Excision Subtraction First Pathologic Diagnosis Time Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ._The act of removing a part from the whole._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Prior Biopsy Or Excision Subtraction First Pathologic Diagnosis Time
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.:The act of removing a part from the whole.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.
The act of removing a part from the whole.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Property.preferredDefinition: The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The period of time during which something continues.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CQCF Update for Method of Tumor and Normal per request by T.Lichtenberg. mc 10/23/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours._The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Calculation created for TCGA content requested by Dr. Ari Kahn.  This VD uses a calculation of dividing a value by the number of milliseconds in a day (86,400,000) to result in a number of days, stored as a whole number.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Number of Days from Date of D
ReferenceDocuments.description: Number of Days from Date of Diagnosis to Date of Prior Biopsy or Resection

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for CQCF Update for Method of Tumor and Normal per request by T.Lichtenberg. mc 10/23/15
